## Description {#details}

This file contains the declarations of the Vectorization Plan base classes:

<ul>
<li>VPBasicBlock and VPRegionBlock that inherit from a common pure virtual VPBlockBase, together implementing a Hierarchical CFG;</li>
<li>Pure virtual VPRecipeBase serving as the base class for recipes contained within VPBasicBlocks;</li>
<li>Pure virtual VPSingleDefRecipe serving as a base class for recipes that also inherit from VPValue.</li>
<li>VPInstruction, a concrete Recipe and VPUser modeling a single planned instruction;</li>
<li>The VPlan class holding a candidate for vectorization;</li>
<li>The VPlanPrinter class providing a way to print a plan in dot format; These are documented in docs/VectorizationPlan.rst.</li>
</ul>

<Link id="l02008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2008"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A pure virtual base class for all recipes modeling header phis, including</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2009"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// phis for first order recurrences, pointer inductions and reductions. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2010"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// start value is the first operand of the recipe and the incoming value from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2011"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the backedge is the second operand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2012"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2013"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Inductions are modeled using the following sub-classes:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2014"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; VPCanonicalIVPHIRecipe: Canonical scalar induction of the vector loop,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2015"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    starting at a specified value (zero for the main vector loop, the resume</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2016"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    value for the epilogue vector loop) and stepping by 1 The induction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2017"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    controls exiting of the vector loop by comparing against the vector trip</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2018"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    count. Produces a single scalar PHI for the induction value per</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2019"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    iteration.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2020"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; VPWidenIntOrFpInductionRecipe: Generates vector values for integer and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2021"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    floating point inductions with arbitrary start and step values. Produces</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2022"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    a vector PHI per-part.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2023"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; VPDerivedIVRecipe: Converts the canonical IV value to the corresponding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2024"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    value of an IV with different start and step values. Produces a single</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2025"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    scalar value per iteration</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2026"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; VPScalarIVStepsRecipe: Generates scalar values per-lane based on a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2027"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    canonical or derived induction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2028"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; VPWidenPointerInductionRecipe: Generate vector and scalar values for a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2029"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    pointer induction. Produces either a vector PHI per-part or scalar values</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2030"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    per-lane based on the canonical induction.</span></CodeLine>
